pullRequest.body:
Prove that convex functions from an open set in a finite dimensional real normed space are locally Lipschitz on that set.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
- [x] depends on: #14660
- [x] depends on: #16111
- [x] depends on: #16115
- [x] depends on: #16117
- [x] depends on: #16118

#### Import changes for modified files

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ConcaveOn.continuousOn_tfae`
`+ ConcaveOn.exists_lipschitzOnWith_of_isBounded`
`+ ConcaveOn.isBoundedUnder_abs`
`+ ConcaveOn.lipschitzOnWith_of_abs_le`
`+ ConcaveOn.locallyLipschitz`
`+ ConcaveOn.locallyLipschitzOn`
`+ ConcaveOn.locallyLipschitzOn_iff_continuousOn`
`+ ConcaveOn.locallyLipschitzOn_interior`
`+ ConvexOn.continuousOn`
`+ ConvexOn.continuousOn_interior`
`+ ConvexOn.continuousOn_tfae`
`+ ConvexOn.exists_lipschitzOnWith_of_isBounded`
`+ ConvexOn.isBoundedUnder_abs`
`+ ConvexOn.lipschitzOnWith_of_abs_le`
`+ ConvexOn.locallyLipschitz`
`+ ConvexOn.locallyLipschitzOn`
`+ ConvexOn.locallyLipschitzOn_iff_continuousOn`
`+ ConvexOn.locallyLipschitzOn_interior`
`- intrinsicClosure_eq_closure_of_span`
`- intrinsicClosure_univ`
`- intrinsicFrontier_eq_frontier_of_span`
`- intrinsicFrontier_univ`
`- intrinsicInterior_eq_interior_of_span`
`- intrinsicInterior_univ`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16111~~

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11124678387/job/30910726047)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11124678387/job/30910726784)

Thanks!

bors d+

Thanks!

bors d+
What's the motivation for swapping this for `NormedGroup`? The two spellings are equivalent, right?

(phrased another way: this refactor looks out of scope for this PR, and if you're serious about wanting to avoid NormedGroup entirely in favor of the less-bundled spelling, probably deserves a Zulip thread)
Yes, true. They are equivalent. Why do we even have lemmas stated with `SeminormedGroup` + `T0Space`?
@PatrickMassot, just checking: Is it fine if I split this item in two?
We've performened splits in the past - see "power series expansion of elementary functions" below, which gained sub-items. Perhaps sub-items here are a reasonable compromise?
I have done so

Just noting that those `proof_wanted` are linted against by a combination of the unused arguments linter and the new variable inclusion mechanism linter!

cc @Kha
That command should probably just disable those linters locally
Opened https://github.com/leanprover-community/batteries/issues/938
This is more readable written with one part of the equivalence per line, especially because the commas here have two meanings.
Make sure to do the same for ConcaveOn!
Whoops, did so, but not so well

```suggestion
    have hx' : x ∈ ball x₀ r := hx₀r hx
```
and similar below
I think this might make a good auxiliary lemma, after you've matched the quantifiers on this line?
Please remove this non-terminal simp.
Please remove this non-terminal simp.

How about:
```suggestion
lemma ConvexOn.exists_lipschitzOnWith_of_isBounded (hf : ConvexOn ℝ (ball x₀ r) f)
    (hf' : IsBounded (f '' ball x₀ r)) {r' : ℝ} (h : r' < r) :
    ∃ K, LipschitzOnWith K f (ball x₀ r') := by
```
I am not convinced. As you see in the calculations, `ε` is the important quantity, and one could write a version of the lemma giving the Lipschitz constant in terms of the bound and `ε`.
Well, split out the quantitative version
As above, I think preferable to use `r' < r` rather than `r - ε`.
Just a remark that this lemma seems to make a case for a `ConvexAt` predicate.
I tend to agree 😁 but I have no other use case in mind for now
Please either locally disable to linter and uncomment the below or else add a comment explaining why these are commented out.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Convex functions are continuous
